page.title: 11REIGATE FIRE STATION
page.content: The present{Reigate Fire Station} which is situated in Croydon Road, was built in l973. The Brigade and Divisional Headquarters for Surrey share the site. There are four {watches}- Red, Blue, White and Green with twelve men in each watch. The firemen wear a cork helmet, thick tunic, yellow PVC over-trousers and black rubber boots with steel toecaps. The Fire Station has a {mobile} {control unit }which is the only one in Surrey. It is called out when five fire engines are being used. The Fire Station has two fire and rescue machines which carry water, foam, hoses and rescue equipment. There are two Emergency Equipment vehicles which are used for rescue and salvage.
